name: Tiny Deathmatch
description:
Tiny Deathmatch, is a multiplayer game (up to 4 players) versus humans or CPU controlled, programmed 100% in Locomotive Basic for the Amstrad CPC retro computers.

This game is inspired by Gorillas: "Gorillas, also known under the source code's file name GORILLA.BAS, is a video game first distributed with MS-DOS 5 and published in 1991 by Microsoft. It is a turn-based artillery game" (Wikipedia)

CONTROLS

Redefineable keys.
The default assigned keys are:

'A' Key
MOVE TO LEFT'D' Key
MOVE TO RIGHT'W' Key
UP/ENABLE FIRING MODE/POWER UP'S' Key
DOWN/POWER DOWNSPACE BAR
SHOT FIRE'P' KEY
ABORT MOVEMENT OR MATCH GAME DESIGN

Program, game graphics: Francesc Alcaucer

Loading screen: Frame from PREDATOR magnificient action movie.

Gesture: A character from the video game 'Larcenas' appears on the landscape generation screen.

NOTICE: Firmware 1.0 have many bugs than 1.1 don't. In this production, one of this bugs causes game freezes for a seconds then continues. My apologize for this inconvenience... maybe you can play DSK version on a 664/6128 model computer.
